Package com.intellij.psi.util

Interface PsiModificationTracker

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ModificationTracker
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PsiModificationTrackerImpl

    public interface PsiModificationTracker
extends ModificationTracker
    An interface used to support tracking of common PSI modifications. It has three main usage patterns:
    1. Get a stamp of current PSI state. This stamp is increased when PSI is modified, allowing other subsystems to check if PSI has changed since they accessed it last time. This can be used to flush and rebuild various internal caches. See getModificationCount(), getJavaStructureModificationCount(), getOutOfCodeBlockModificationCount()
    2. Make a CachedValue instance dependent on a specific PSI modification tracker. To achieve that, one should can one of the constants in this interface as CachedValueProvider.Result dependencies.
    3. Subscribe to any PSI change (for example, to drop caches in the listener manually). See PsiModificationTracker.Listener

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  PsiModificationTracker.Listener
      A listener to be notified on any PSI modification count change (which happens on any physical PSI change).
      static class  PsiModificationTracker.SERVICE
      Provides a way to get the instance of PsiModificationTracker corresponding to a given project.

    • Field Detail

      • MODIFICATION_COUNT

        static final Key MODIFICATION_COUNT
        This key can be passed as a dependency in a CachedValueProvider. The corresponding CachedValue will then be flushed on every physical PSI change.
        See Also:
        getModificationCount()

      • OUT_OF_CODE_BLOCK_MODIFICATION_COUNT

        @Deprecated
static final Key OUT_OF_CODE_BLOCK_MODIFICATION_COUNT
        Deprecated. rarely supported by language plugins; also a wrong way for optimisations
        This key can be passed as a dependency in a CachedValueProvider. The corresponding CachedValue will then be flushed on every physical PSI change that doesn't happen inside a Java code block. This can include changes on Java class or file level, or changes in non-Java files, e.g. XML. Rarely needed.
        See Also:
        getOutOfCodeBlockModificationCount()

      • JAVA_STRUCTURE_MODIFICATION_COUNT

        @Deprecated
static final Key JAVA_STRUCTURE_MODIFICATION_COUNT
        Deprecated. rarely supported by JVM language plugins; also a wrong way for optimisations
        This key can be passed as a dependency in a CachedValueProvider. The corresponding CachedValue will then be flushed on every physical PSI change that can affect Java structure and resolve.
        See Also:
        getJavaStructureModificationCount()

      • TOPIC

        static final Topic<PsiModificationTracker.Listener> TOPIC
        A topic to subscribe for all PSI modification count changes.
        See Also:
        MessageBus

    • Method Detail

      • getModificationCount

        long getModificationCount()
        Tracks any PSI modification.
        Specified by:
        getModificationCount in interface ModificationTracker
        Returns:
        current counter value. Increased whenever any physical PSI is changed.

      • getOutOfCodeBlockModificationCount

        @Deprecated
long getOutOfCodeBlockModificationCount()
        Deprecated. rarely supported by language plugins; also a wrong way for optimisations
        Returns:
        Same as getJavaStructureModificationCount(), but also includes changes in non-Java files, e.g. XML. Rarely needed.

      • getOutOfCodeBlockModificationTracker

        @Deprecated
ModificationTracker getOutOfCodeBlockModificationTracker()
        Deprecated. rarely supported by language plugins; also a wrong way for optimisations
        Returns:
        an object returning getOutOfCodeBlockModificationCount()

      • getJavaStructureModificationCount

        @Deprecated
long getJavaStructureModificationCount()
        Deprecated. rarely supported by JVM language plugins; also a wrong way for optimisations
        Tracks structural Java modifications, i.e. the ones on class/method/field/file level. Modifications inside method bodies are not tracked. Useful to work with resolve caches that only depend on Java structure, and not the method code.
        Returns:
        current counter value. Increased whenever any physical PSI in Java structure is changed.

      • getJavaStructureModificationTracker

        @Deprecated
ModificationTracker getJavaStructureModificationTracker()
        Deprecated. rarely supported by JVM language plugins; also a wrong way for optimisations
        Returns:
        an object returning getJavaStructureModificationCount()
